When your account is public, your profile and posts can be seen by anyone, on or off Instagram, even if they don't have an Instagram account. When your account is private, only the followers you approve can see what you share, including your photos or videos on hashtag and location pages, and your followers and following lists.
You can block people anytime from their profiles.

Comments that are potentially offensive, misleading or spam will be moved to a separate section. Anyone can see these comments, and you can unhide comments on your own posts at anytime.
Even more comments that meet our criteria will automatically be hidden.

Message requests that may be offensive, spam or scams will be moved to the Hidden requests folder. We'll also filter notifications for these messages. This feature is not currently supported on web or Meta Quest.

Comments that contain words, phrases or emojis on your custom list and similar misspellings will be filtered out so they are only visible to the authors.
Message requests that contain words from your list will be hidden. This feature is not currently supported on web or Meta Quest.

settings.description: By enabling this setting, you can override the display name that AI Companion detects for you with the full display name set in your profile.
Create clips that uses your user's chosen avatar to read the script they enter.
Allow users to create custom avatars for clips that would read the script they enter.
A link to manage cookie settings.

settings.setting: Do Not Sell My Personal Information
settings.description: A link to opt-out of the sale of personal information.
Allow hosts and participants to record the meeting to a computer. The recording will include video and shared content matching the recorder's view options, and an audio-only file.

settings.setting: Who can request host permission to record? - Internal meeting participants
settings.description: Allow internal meeting participants to request permission to record.

settings.setting: Who can request host permission to record? - Auto approve their permission requests (Internal)
settings.description: Automatically approve permission requests from internal meeting participants.

settings.setting: Who can request host permission to record? - External meeting participants
settings.description: Allow external meeting participants to request permission to record.

settings.setting: Who can request host permission to record? - Auto approve their permission requests (External)
settings.description: Automatically approve permission requests from external meeting participants.

settings.setting: Who can request host permission to record? - Meeting participants with specified domains
settings.description: Allow meeting participants with specified domains to request permission to record. Participants matching this option will take the precedence regardless the above two options.
Record meetings automatically as they start
Controls for whom a voice prompt is played when a recording starts. By default, all users will see a recording disclaimer and hear an audio notification when a recording starts.
By default, phone users will hear one audio notification indicating that a recording has started. This enables multiple notifications.
Automatically call all accepted participants (those who replied with Yes, Maybe, or No reply) at the scheduled time, regardless of whether the host has joined the meeting.

settings.setting: Require that all meetings are secured with one security option
settings.description: Require that all meetings are secured with one of the following security options: a passcode, Waiting Room, or 'Only authenticated users can join meetings'. If no security option is enabled, Zoom will secure all meetings with Waiting Room.

When participants join a meeting, place them in a waiting room and require the host to admit them individually. Enabling the waiting room automatically disables the setting for allowing participants to join before host.
All instant, and scheduled meetings that users can join via client, or room systems will be passcode-protected. The Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings are not included.

settings.setting: Require a passcode for meetings which have already been scheduled
settings.description: A sub-setting under Meeting Passcode to apply a passcode to previously scheduled meetings.
The passcode to be applied to meetings that have already been scheduled.
All Personal Meeting ID (PMI) meetings that users can join via client, or room systems will be passcode-protected.
The passcode for Personal Meeting ID meetings.

settings.setting: Require passcode for participants joining by phone
settings.description: A numeric passcode will be required for participants joining by phone if your meeting has a passcode. For meeting with an alphanumeric passcode, a numeric version will be generated.

settings.setting: Embed passcode in invite link for one-click join
settings.description: Meeting passcode will be encrypted and included in the invite link to allow participants to join with just one click without having to enter the passcode.

settings.setting: Allow Zoom Rooms to become the host if they join before meeting host and other participants
settings.description: When this option is enabled, Zoom Rooms configured to 'Make Zoom Rooms the host if it joins before meeting host and other participants' will be permitted to assume the host role if they join before the meeting host and other participants.

settings.setting: Only authenticated users can join meetings from Web client
settings.description: The participants need to authenticate prior to joining meetings from web client.

settings.setting: Approve or block entry for users from specific countries/regions
settings.description: Determine whether users from specific regions or countries can join meetings/webinars on your account by adding them to your Approved List or Blocked List. Blocking regions may limit CRC, Dial-in, Call Me, and Invite by Phone options for participants joining from those regions.
If the admin locks this setting, users will not be able to change the encryption type for meetings (i.e. scheduled, instant, PMI).
Start meetings with host video on
Start meetings with participant video on. Participants can change this when joining or in the meeting.

Determine how participants can join the audio portion of the meeting. When joining audio, you can let them choose to use their computer microphone/speaker or use a telephone. You can also limit them to just one of those audio types. If you have 3rd party audio enabled, you can require that all participants follow the instructions you provide for using non-Zoom audio.

settings.setting: Allow participants to join before host
settings.description: Allow participants to join before the host arrives. If participants are not allowed to join before the host, or the host has another meeting running, participants will see a dialog that notifies them that the meeting has not started. This dialog can be customized through the Customize Waiting Room setting.

settings.setting: Participants can join [time] before start time
settings.description: Specifies the time before the meeting starts that participants can join.
A Personal Meeting ID (PMI) is a 9 to 11 digit number that is assigned to your account. You can visit Personal Meeting Room to change your personal meeting settings.

settings.setting: Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when scheduling a meeting
settings.description: You can visit Personal Meeting Room to change your Personal Meeting settings.

settings.setting: Use Personal Meeting ID (PMI) when starting an instant meeting
settings.description: Use the Personal Meeting ID for instant meetings.

settings.setting: Mute all participants when they join a meeting
settings.description: Automatically mute all participants when they join the meeting. The host controls whether participants can unmute themselves.
Receive desktop notification for upcoming meetings. Reminder time can be configured in the Zoom Desktop Client.

settings.setting: Don't allow agendas to be shared with external users
settings.description: By default, the meeting agenda is automatically shared with all invitees. When this setting is enabled, the agenda will be shared only with invitees in your organization.

settings.setting: Require media encryption for 3rd party endpoints (SIP/H.323)
settings.description: By default, Zoom requires encryption for all data transferred between the Zoom cloud, Zoom client, and Zoom Room. Turn on this setting to require media encryption for 3rd party endpoints (SIP/H.323) as well. 3rd party (SIP/H.323) endpoints that cannot negotiate media encryption compatible with Zoom's standards will be blocked from joining Zoom meetings.
Allow meeting and webinar participants to send chat messages.

settings.setting: By default, allow participants to chat with
settings.description: Controls the default chat permissions for participants in a meeting.

Allow meeting participants to communicate without interrupting by reacting with emojis (e.g. clap, heart, laugh). These emojis are found in the Reactions menu in the toolbar, and when selected, they display on the participant's video and in the participants list for 10 seconds. Participants can change their emoji skin tone in Settings.
Allow previously removed meeting participants and webinar panelists to rejoin

settings.setting: Show invitee list in the Participants panel
settings.description: Users invited to meetings on other platforms (e.g. Google, Outlook, or Exchange) will also be shown on this list

settings.setting: Allow users to change their name when joining a meeting
settings.description: By disabling this setting, users will always use their name on profile page to join a meeting
Allow meeting participants and webinar panelists to rename themselves.

settings.setting: Allow host or co-host to rename participants in the waiting room
settings.description: Participants will be notified of name change

settings.setting: Hide participant profile pictures in a meeting
settings.description: All participant profile pictures will be hidden and only the names of participants will be displayed on the video screen. Participants will not be able to update their profile pictures in the meeting.
Allow participants to set meeting timers that can be seen and heard by everyone.
Select a default meeting wallpaper to be used for all meetings in your organization.

settings.setting: Allow users to join external meetings, webinars and events through mesh in the local area network
settings.description: If the external account has allowed mesh for any participants to join, some devices might be available as Zoom Mesh parents to distribute audio and video data in the local area network. This will provide a better experience and save bandwidth.
Allow users to report meeting participants for inappropriate behavior to Zoom's Trust and Safety team for review. This setting can be found on the meeting information panel.
Allow host to split meeting participants into separate, smaller rooms

settings.setting: Assign participants to breakout rooms when scheduling
settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.

settings.setting: Allow host to view activity statuses of participants in breakout rooms (e.g. share screen, reactions)
settings.description: A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
A sub-setting of 'Breakout room - Meetings'.
Allow meeting host to provide 1:1 remote support to another participant
Allow host to type closed captions or assign a participant/3rd-party service to add closed captions
Allow users to enable automated captions in these languages in meetings and webinars.
The specific languages enabled for automated captions.
settings.state: Selected languages: Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Traditional), Croatian, Czech, Danish

settings.setting: Allow only the following users to enable captions for the meeting or webinar
settings.description: A checkbox to restrict which users can enable captions.
Allow users to process automated captions on their device in meetings. To use this feature, the device must meet minimum requirements.
Allow viewing of full transcript in the in-meeting side panel
Allow participants to save fully closed captions or transcripts
Allow host to assign participants as sign language interpreters who can interpret one language into sign language in real-time. Host can assign interpreters when scheduling or during the meeting.

settings.setting: Enable sign language interpretation view by default in scheduler
settings.description: A sub-setting to enable sign language interpretation view by default in the scheduler.
Allow another user to take control of your camera during a meeting. Both users (the one requesting control and the one giving control) must have this option turned on.

Allow users to add others to their Camera Control Group. When a member of the group requests camera control, they will automatically take control of the user's camera. Group members can be added or removed in Team Chat or Contacts.
Customize your background to keep your environment private from others in a meeting. This can be used with or without a green screen.

settings.setting: Allow use of videos as virtual backgrounds
settings.description: A sub-setting to permit using videos as virtual backgrounds.
Allow hosts to curate case-specific scenes, such as a classroom or boardroom for their meetings or webinars.
A sub-setting to turn off custom backgrounds.
A mode that shows only hosts and co-hosts' videos and profile pictures during a meeting. Focus Mode can be found in the "More" menu in the in-meeting toolbar.

settings.setting: Identify guest participants in the meeting/webinar
settings.description: Participants who belong to your account can see that a guest (someone who does not belong to your account) is participating in the meeting/webinar. The Participants list indicates which attendees are guests. The guests themselves do not see that they are listed as guests.
Allow user to add others to an 'Auto Answer Group'. Calls from members of a user's 'Auto Answer Group' will be automatically answered for that user.

settings.setting: Only show default email when sending email invites
settings.description: Allow users to invite participants by email only by using the default email program selected on their computer

settings.setting: Use HTML format email for Outlook add-in and plug-in
settings.description: Use HTML formatting instead of plain text for meeting invitations scheduled with the Outlook plugin

settings.setting: Override Zoom Outlook add-in local setting
settings.description: When enabled, the settings you set below will override users' local add-in settings.

settings.setting: Show a "Join from your browser" link
settings.description: Allow participants to bypass the Zoom application download process,
Allows users to join a meeting directly from their desktop browser. Note that the meeting experience from the browser is limited.
Allows users to join a meeting directly from their mobile browser. Note that the meeting experience from the mobile browser is more limited than the desktop browser.

settings.setting: Show "Always join from browser" option when joining from join.zoom.us
settings.description: Allow account members to enable "Always join from browser" when they join meetings from join.zoom.us.

settings.setting: Show a custom disclaimer when starting or joining a meeting
settings.description: Create your own disclaimer that will be shown at the start of all meetings hosted by your account.
Select this option in the scheduler to request permission to unmute meeting participants and webinar panelists. Permissions, once given, will apply in all meetings scheduled by the same person.
Allow another user to take control of your audio controls during a meeting. Both users (the one requesting control and the one giving control) must have this option turned on.

Allow users to add others to their Audio Control Group. When a member of the group requests audio control, they will automatically take control of the user's audio settings. Group members can be added or removed in Team Chat or Contacts.

Allows meeting participants to turn off all incoming video feeds on their screen (does not affect other participants' screens). To access this feature, click the view button at the top-right corner of your screen.

settings.setting: When attendees join meeting before host
settings.description: Notify host when participants join the meeting before them.
Notify host and participants when the meeting is cancelled.
You can assign users in your account to schedule meetings on your behalf. You can also schedule meetings on behalf of someone that has assigned you scheduling privilege.
settings.state: Assign scheduling privilege to: No one, I can schedule for: No one

settings.description: Select the display language for the website.
Select the currency for display.
Link to manage your privacy choices.
Link to manage cookie preferences.
Allow collection of additional data that helps Zoom make product improvements and provide enhanced information to help Zoom detect, diagnose, and remediate issues.
Allow collection of additional data that helps Zoom make product improvements and provide enhanced information to help Zoom detect, diagnose, and remediate issues.
Allow collection of additional data that helps Zoom make product improvements and provide enhanced information to help Zoom detect, diagnose, and remediate issues.
Allow collection of additional data that helps Zoom make product improvements and provide enhanced information to help Zoom detect, diagnose, and remediate issues.
